meaningMnemonic:
This the noun version of the kanji for <kanji>smell</kanji>. It also means <vocabulary>smell</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>scent</vocabulary>!

Although 匂う often implies something smells unpleasant, 匂い is more neutral and can refer to any kind of smell.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned this reading with the kanji, so you should be able to read it already!
